allow:
Bash(and autos" forces eBay to find cards with ALL keywords, missing cards that
only match some criteria \(refractor-only, auto-only, etc\).

Solution: Parse query, detect multiple card types, run separate searches,
deduplicate, score against full original query.

Features:
- Smart query parser detects card type keywords \(refractor, auto, numbered, etc\)
- Extracts base query \(player, year, brand\) from card types
- Runs optimized separate searches for each card type
- Deduplicates by item ID across all searches
- Scores all results against full original query for relevance
- Shows what each card matches/misses from original criteria

Example: "2003 wade refractors, numbered, autos" becomes:
  - Search 1: "2003 wade refractor" \(200 results\)
  - Search 2: "2003 wade numbered" \(200 results\)
  - Search 3: "2003 wade auto" \(200 results\)
  - Combined: 536 unique cards vs 3 with single search

Result: 10x more relevant results by finding cards matching ANY criteria
instead of requiring ALL keywords.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
